org.safs.selenium.rmi.agent

Class SeleniumAgent

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
      • java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
        • java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
          • org.safs.rmi.engine.RemoteRoot
            • org.safs.selenium.rmi.agent.SeleniumAgent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.rmi.Remote, SeleniumRMIAgent

    public class SeleniumAgent
extends RemoteRoot
implements SeleniumRMIAgent
    Default Selenium RMI Agent intended to communicate with a remote standalone Selenium Server JVM.

    Because this is an RMI implementation, an additional Java rmic build process is necessary prior to creating the JAR file containing all classes. The Java rmic program creates the Skeletons and Stubs needed by Java RMI.

    Execute Java rmic from the root directory of the Java project:

    rmic -d . org.safs.selenium.rmi.agent.SeleniumAgent

    Note: For consistent operation the safs.server.hostname needs to be set in code or on the command line before launching an Agent connecting to a remote Selenium RMI Server:

    • In Code:

        System.setProperty("safs.server.hostname", "<rmi server ip>");

        System.setProperty("safs.server.hostname", "hostname.company.internal.net");

    • Command line:

        -Dsafs.server.hostname=<rmi server ip>

        -Dsafs.server.hostname=hostname.company.internal.net
    Author:
    Carl Nagle MAR 03, 2015 Original Release
    See Also:
    SeleniumServerRunner, SeleniumRMIServer, SeleniumServer, Serialized Form

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Used locally to cease all agent operations with any server and commence a complete RMI disconnect. This is necessary to allow the RMI threads to allow the JVM to exit.

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
              throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Called from the remote RMI Server. Removes any RMI server reference we might already have and restarts a new ServerMonitor to watch for a new RMI server object.
        Specified by:
        shutdown in interface SeleniumRMIAgent
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        See Also:
        Agent.shutdown()

      • runCommand

        public java.lang.Object runCommand(java.lang.Object command)
                            throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                   java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: SeleniumRMIAgent
        Called by an RMI Server. This is a "do anything" function that the Server and Clients have a private contract to implement. It essentially allows a Client/Server implementation to pass anything back and forth and act according to the shared design.

        For example, the Client and Server may have been coded to pass string commands back and forth and the string commands can be parsed to provide an unlimited number of command possibilities.

        Specified by:
        runCommand in interface SeleniumRMIAgent
        Parameters:
        command - Object of a type expected by the Client implementation for this method.
        Returns:
        Object of a type expected by the Server implementation calling this method.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        java.lang.Exception

      • remoteWaitReaction

        public void remoteWaitReaction(boolean wait)
                        throws java.rmi.ServerException,
                               java.lang.Exception
        Set if wait for reaction to "input keys/chars" for remote server.
        Parameters:
        wait - boolean if wait or not.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.ServerException - if the command did not execute successfully
        java.lang.Exception
        See Also:
        Robot.setWaitReaction(boolean)

      • remoteWaitReaction

        public void remoteWaitReaction(boolean wait,
                               int tokenLength,
                               int dealyForToken,
                               int dealy)
                        throws java.rmi.ServerException,
                               java.lang.Exception
        Set if wait for reaction to "input keys/chars" for remote server.
        Parameters:
        wait - boolean, if wait or not.
        tokenLength - int, the length of a token. Only if the string is longer than this then we wait the reaction after input-keys a certain time indicated by the parameter dealyForToken.
        dealyForToken - int, The delay in millisecond to wait the reaction after input-keys for the string as long as a token.
        dealy - int, The constant delay in millisecond to wait the reaction after input-keys.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.ServerException - if the command did not execute successfully
        java.lang.Exception
        See Also:
        Robot.setWaitReaction(boolean, int, int, int)

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        For test purposes only.
        Parameters:
        args - String[]
        • args[0] command
        • args[1] parameter
        • args[2] parameter
        For example we can call a "click" command by giving the following parameters:
        //screen_x, screen_y, mouseButtonNumber, nclicks
        click 300 500 16 1

        Use -Dsafs.server.hostname on command-line to specify the RMI host to contact.

          -Dsafs.server.hostname=<Remote Server host>

        Note: Normally Java creates a registry Object object using a konwn port 1099. The "SAFS RMI server" has been registered on the RMI host by that registry. If the registry is created on an other port, we need to set registry.port in code or on the command line so that we can find the the "SAFS RMI server".

          -Dregistry.port=<Remote Registry port>
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
